00042 static int
00043 proxy_parser_header_key(htparser * p, const char * data, size_t len) {
00044     request_t       * request;
00045     rproxy_t        * rproxy;
00046     evhtp_request_t * upstream_r;
00047     evhtp_header_t  * hdr;
00048     char            * key_s;
00049 
00050     assert(p != NULL);
00051 
00052     request = htparser_get_userdata(p);
00053     assert(request != NULL);
00054 
00055     rproxy  = request->rproxy;
00056     assert(rproxy != NULL);
00057 
00058     if (REQUEST_HAS_ERROR(request)) {
00059         return -1;
00060     }
00061 
00062     if (!(upstream_r = request->upstream_request)) {
00063         logger_log_request_error(rproxy->logger, request,
00064                                  "[ERROR] upstream_request == NULL");
00065         request->error = 1;
00066         return -1;
00067     }
00068 
00069     if (!(key_s = malloc(len + 1))) {
00070         logger_log_request_error(request->rproxy->logger, request,
00071                                  "[CRIT] Could not malloc: %s", strerror(errno));
00072         exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00073     }
00074 
00075     key_s[len]    = '\0';
00076     memcpy(key_s, data, len);
00077 
00078     hdr           = evhtp_header_key_add(upstream_r->headers_out, key_s, 0);
00079     hdr->k_heaped = 1;
00080 
00081     return 0;
00082 }
00083 
00093 static int
00094 proxy_parser_header_val(htparser * p, const char * data, size_t len) {
00095     request_t       * request;
00096     rproxy_t        * rproxy;
00097     evhtp_request_t * upstream_r;
00098     evhtp_header_t  * hdr;
00099     char            * val_s;
00100 
00101     assert(p != NULL);
00102 
00103     request = htparser_get_userdata(p);
00104     assert(request != NULL);
00105 
00106     rproxy  = request->rproxy;
00107     assert(rproxy != NULL);
00108 
00109     if (REQUEST_HAS_ERROR(request)) {
00110         return -1;
00111     }
00112 
00113     if (!(upstream_r = request->upstream_request)) {
00114         logger_log_request_error(rproxy->logger, request,
00115                                  "[ERROR] header_val upstream_r == NULL");
00116         request->error = 1;
00117         return -1;
00118     }
00119 
00120     if (!(val_s = calloc(len + 1, 1))) {
00121         logger_log_request_error(request->rproxy->logger, request,
00122                                  "[CRIT] Could not malloc: %s", strerror(errno));
00123         exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00124     }
00125 
00126 
00127     val_s[len]    = '\0';
00128     memcpy(val_s, data, len);
00129 
00130     hdr           = evhtp_header_val_add(upstream_r->headers_out, val_s, 0);
00131     hdr->v_heaped = 1;
00132 
00133     return 0;
00134 } /* proxy_parser_header_val */

00147 static int
00148 proxy_parser_headers_complete(htparser * p) {
00149     request_t       * request;
00150     rproxy_t        * rproxy;
00151     evhtp_request_t * upstream_r;
00152 
00153     assert(p != NULL);
00154 
00155     request = htparser_get_userdata(p);
00156     assert(request != NULL);
00157 
00158     rproxy  = request->rproxy;
00159     assert(rproxy != NULL);
00160     assert(request->pending != 0);
00161 
00162     if (REQUEST_HAS_ERROR(request)) {
00163         return -1;
00164     }
00165 
00166     if (!(upstream_r = request->upstream_request)) {
00167         logger_log_request_error(rproxy->logger, request,
00168                                  "[ERROR] parser_headers_complete() upstream_r == NULL");
00169         request->error = 1;
00170         return -1;
00171     }
00172 
00173     /* downstream headers have been fully parsed, start streaming
00174      * further data to the upstream
00175      */
00176     evhtp_send_reply_start(upstream_r, htparser_get_status(p));
00177 
00178     if (REQUEST_HAS_ERROR(request)) {
00179         return -1;
00180     }
00181 
00182     /* in the case the original upstream request was a HEAD method,
00183      * the body of the response will be empty, set the request to done,
00184      * but return -1 to stop the parsing process.
00185      */
00186     if (upstream_r->method == htp_method_HEAD) {
00187         request->error = 0;
00188         request->done  = 1;
00189         return -1;
00190     }
00191 
00192     return 0;
00193 } /* proxy_parser_headers_complete */
00194 
00205 static int
00206 proxy_parser_new_chunk(htparser * p) {
00207     request_t       * request;
00208     rproxy_t        * rproxy;
00209     evhtp_request_t * upstream_r;
00210     evbuf_t         * buf;
00211 
00212     assert(p != NULL);
00213 
00214     request = htparser_get_userdata(p);
00215     assert(request != NULL);
00216     rproxy  = request->rproxy;
00217 
00218     if (REQUEST_HAS_ERROR(request)) {
00219         return -1;
00220     }
00221 
00222     if (!(upstream_r = request->upstream_request)) {
00223         logger_log_request_error(rproxy->logger, request,
00224                                  "[ERROR] parser_new_chunk() upstream_r == NULL");
00225         request->error = 1;
00226         return -1;
00227     }
00228 
00229     if (!(buf = evbuffer_new())) {
00230         logger_log_request_error(request->rproxy->logger, request,
00231                                  "[CRIT] Could not malloc: %s", strerror(errno));
00232         exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00233     }
00234 
00235     /* create and send a new chunk line to the upstream */
00236     evbuffer_add_printf(buf, "%x\r\n",
00237                         (unsigned int)htparser_get_content_length(p));
00238 
00239     evhtp_send_reply_body(upstream_r, buf);
00240 
00241     evbuffer_free(buf);
00242 
00243     if (REQUEST_HAS_ERROR(request)) {
00244         return -1;
00245     }
00246 
00247     return 0;
00248 } /* proxy_parser_new_chunk */
00249 
00262 static int
00263 proxy_parser_chunk_complete(htparser * p) {
00264     /* an entire chunk has been parsed, send the final CRLF to the upstream */
00265     request_t       * request;
00266     rproxy_t        * rproxy;
00267     evhtp_request_t * upstream_r;
00268     evbuf_t         * buf;
00269 
00270     assert(p != NULL);
00271 
00272     request = htparser_get_userdata(p);
00273     assert(request != NULL);
00274 
00275     rproxy  = request->rproxy;
00276     assert(rproxy != NULL);
00277 
00278     if (REQUEST_HAS_ERROR(request)) {
00279         return -1;
00280     }
00281 
00282     if (!(upstream_r = request->upstream_request)) {
00283         logger_log_request_error(rproxy->logger, request,
00284                                  "[ERROR] parser_chunk_complete() upstream_r == NULL");
00285         request->error = 1;
00286         return -1;
00287     }
00288 
00289     if (!(buf = evbuffer_new())) {
00290         logger_log_request_error(request->rproxy->logger, request,
00291                                  "[CRIT] Could not malloc: %s", strerror(errno));
00292         exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00293     }
00294 
00295     /* add a CRLF to terminate a single chunk */
00296     evbuffer_add(buf, "\r\n", 2);
00297     evhtp_send_reply_body(upstream_r, buf);
00298     evbuffer_free(buf);
00299 
00300     if (REQUEST_HAS_ERROR(request)) {
00301         return -1;
00302     }
00303 
00304     return 0;
00305 } /* proxy_parser_chunk_complete */
00306 
00317 static int
00318 proxy_parser_chunks_complete(htparser * p) {
00319     /* all chunks have been parsed, send the terminating 0 and CRLF */
00320     request_t       * request;
00321     rproxy_t        * rproxy;
00322     evhtp_request_t * upstream_r;
00323     evbuf_t         * buf;
00324 
00325     assert(p != NULL);
00326 
00327     request = htparser_get_userdata(p);
00328     assert(request != NULL);
00329     rproxy  = request->rproxy;
00330 
00331     if (REQUEST_HAS_ERROR(request)) {
00332         return -1;
00333     }
00334 
00335     if (!(upstream_r = request->upstream_request)) {
00336         logger_log_request_error(rproxy->logger, request,
00337                                  "[ERROR] chunks_complete() upstream_r == NULL");
00338         request->error = 1;
00339         return -1;
00340     }
00341 
00342     if (!(buf = evbuffer_new())) {
00343         logger_log_error(request->rproxy->logger,
00344                          "[CRIT] Could not malloc: %s", strerror(errno));
00345         exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00346     }
00347 
00348     evbuffer_add(buf, "0\r\n\r\n", 5);
00349     evhtp_send_reply_body(upstream_r, buf);
00350     evbuffer_free(buf);
00351 
00352     if (REQUEST_HAS_ERROR(request)) {
00353         return -1;
00354     }
00355 
00356     return 0;
00357 }
00358 
00371 static int
00372 proxy_parser_body(htparser * p, const char * data, size_t len) {
00373     /* stream parsed body data from the downstream to the upstream */
00374     request_t       * request;
00375     rproxy_t        * rproxy;
00376     evhtp_request_t * upstream_r;
00377     evbuf_t         * buf;
00378 
00379     assert(p != NULL);
00380 
00381     request = htparser_get_userdata(p);
00382     assert(request != NULL);
00383 
00384     rproxy  = request->rproxy;
00385     assert(rproxy != NULL);
00386 
00387     if (REQUEST_HAS_ERROR(request)) {
00388         return -1;
00389     }
00390 
00391     if (!(upstream_r = request->upstream_request)) {
00392         logger_log_request_error(rproxy->logger, request,
00393                                  "[ERROR] parser_body() upstream_r == NULL");
00394         request->error = 1;
00395         return -1;
00396     }
00397 
00398     if (!(buf = evbuffer_new())) {
00399         logger_log_request_error(request->rproxy->logger, request,
00400                                  "[CRIT] Could not malloc: %s", strerror(errno));
00401         exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00402     }
00403 
00404     evbuffer_add(buf, data, len);
00405     evhtp_send_reply_body(upstream_r, buf);
00406     evbuffer_free(buf);
00407 
00408     if (REQUEST_HAS_ERROR(request)) {
00409         return -1;
00410     }
00411 
00412     return 0;
00413 } /* proxy_parser_body */
00414 
00415 static int
00416 proxy_parser_fini(htparser * p) {
00417     request_t       * request;
00418     rproxy_t        * rproxy;
00419     evhtp_request_t * upstream_r;
00420 
00421     assert(p != NULL);
00422 
00423     request = htparser_get_userdata(p);
00424     assert(request != NULL);
00425 
00426     rproxy  = request->rproxy;
00427     assert(rproxy != NULL);
00428 
00429     if (REQUEST_HAS_ERROR(request)) {
00430         return -1;
00431     }
00432 
00433     if (!(upstream_r = request->upstream_request)) {
00434         logger_log_request_error(rproxy->logger, request,
00435                                  "[ERROR] proxy_parser_fini() upstream_r == NULL");
00436         request->error = 1;
00437         return -1;
00438     }
00439 
00440     /* the downstream response has no body data, so we mark the
00441      * request as done. Otherwise we must wait for the http parser
00442      * to call our read body callbacks (proxy_parser_*_chunk*() /
00443      * proxy_parser_body())
00444      */
00445     if (!htparser_get_content_length(request->parser)) {
00446         request->done = 1;
00447     }
00448 
00449     return 0;
00450 }
00451 
00452 static htparse_hooks proxy_parser_hooks = {
00453     .on_msg_begin       = NULL,
00454     .method             = NULL,
00455     .scheme             = NULL,
00456     .host               = NULL,
00457     .port               = NULL,
00458     .path               = NULL,
00459     .args               = NULL,
00460     .uri                = NULL,
00461     .on_hdrs_begin      = NULL,
00462     .hdr_key            = proxy_parser_header_key,
00463     .hdr_val            = proxy_parser_header_val,
00464     .on_hdrs_complete   = proxy_parser_headers_complete,
00465     .on_new_chunk       = proxy_parser_new_chunk,
00466     .on_chunk_complete  = proxy_parser_chunk_complete,
00467     .on_chunks_complete = proxy_parser_chunks_complete,
00468     .body               = proxy_parser_body,
00469     .on_msg_complete    = proxy_parser_fini
00470 };

00472 
00480 int
00481 downstream_connection_set_idle(downstream_c_t * connection) {
00482     downstream_t * downstream;
00483 
00484     if (connection == NULL) {
00485         return -1;
00486     }
00487 
00488     if (!(downstream = connection->parent)) {
00489         return -1;
00490     }
00491 
00492     switch (connection->status) {
00493         case downstream_status_active:
00494             TAILQ_REMOVE(&downstream->active, connection, next);
00495             downstream->num_active -= 1;
00496             break;
00497         case downstream_status_idle:
00498             TAILQ_REMOVE(&downstream->idle, connection, next);
00499             downstream->num_idle   -= 1;
00500             break;
00501         case downstream_status_down:
00502             logger_log_error(downstream->rproxy->logger,
00503                              "[INFO] Downstream %s:%d is now up",
00504                              downstream->config->host, downstream->config->port);
00505             downstream->num_down -= 1;
00506 
00507             TAILQ_REMOVE(&downstream->down, connection, next);
00508             break;
00509         case downstream_status_nil:
00510             break;
00511         default:
00512             return -1;
00513     } /* switch */
00514 
00515     /* if the last state was active, we calculate the RTT */
00516     if (connection->status == downstream_status_active) {
00517         struct timeval diff;
00518         struct timeval now;
00519 
00520         evutil_gettimeofday(&now, NULL);
00521         evutil_timersub(&now, &connection->tv_start, &diff);
00522 
00523         connection->rtt = diff.tv_sec + (diff.tv_usec / 1.0e6);
00524     }
00525 
00526     TAILQ_INSERT_TAIL(&downstream->idle, connection, next);
00527 
00528     connection->request   = NULL;
00529     downstream->num_idle += 1;
00530     connection->status    = downstream_status_idle;
00531 
00532     evtimer_del(connection->retry_timer);
00533 
00534     /* signal the pending request handler that this connection is idle */
00535     event_active(downstream->rproxy->request_ev, EV_WRITE, 1);
00536 
00537     return 0;
00538 } /* downstream_connection_set_idle */
00539 
00548 int
00549 downstream_connection_set_down(downstream_c_t * connection) {
00550     downstream_t * downstream;
00551 
00552     if (connection == NULL) {
00553         return -1;
00554     }
00555 
00556     if (!(downstream = connection->parent)) {
00557         return -1;
00558     }
00559 
00560     if (connection->status != downstream_status_down) {
00561         logger_log_error(downstream->rproxy->logger,
00562                          "[ERROR] Downstream proxy:%d -> %s:%d is down",
00563                          connection->sport,
00564                          downstream->config->host,
00565                          downstream->config->port);
00566     }
00567 
00568     switch (connection->status) {
00569         case downstream_status_active:
00570             TAILQ_REMOVE(&downstream->active, connection, next);
00571             downstream->num_active -= 1;
00572             break;
00573         case downstream_status_idle:
00574             TAILQ_REMOVE(&downstream->idle, connection, next);
00575             downstream->num_idle   -= 1;
00576             break;
00577         case downstream_status_down:
00578             downstream->num_down   -= 1;
00579             TAILQ_REMOVE(&downstream->down, connection, next);
00580             break;
00581         case downstream_status_nil:
00582             break;
00583         default:
00584             return -1;
00585     }
00586 
00587     TAILQ_INSERT_TAIL(&downstream->down, connection, next);
00588 
00589     if (connection->connection) {
00590         bufferevent_free(connection->connection);
00591     }
00592 
00593     downstream->num_down  += 1;
00594     connection->status     = downstream_status_down;
00595     connection->connection = NULL;
00596     connection->rtt        = DBL_MAX;
00597     connection->sport      = 0;
00598 
00599     evtimer_del(connection->retry_timer);
00600     evtimer_add(connection->retry_timer, &downstream->config->retry_ival);
00601 
00602     if (connection->bootstrapped == 0) {
00603         /* this is the first time the connection has been set to down, in most
00604          * casees this means the program has just started up. In this state, we
00605          * want to immediately attempt to connect to the downstream without
00606          * waiting for the retry_timer to expire
00607          */
00608         event_active(connection->retry_timer, EV_READ, 1);
00609         connection->bootstrapped = 1;
00610     }
00611 
00612     return 0;
00613 } /* downstream_connection_set_down */
00614 
00623 int
00624 downstream_connection_set_active(downstream_c_t * connection) {
00625     downstream_t * downstream;
00626 
00627     if (connection == NULL) {
00628         return -1;
00629     }
00630 
00631     if (!(downstream = connection->parent)) {
00632         return -1;
00633     }
00634 
00635     switch (connection->status) {
00636         case downstream_status_active:
00637             TAILQ_REMOVE(&downstream->active, connection, next);
00638             downstream->num_active -= 1;
00639             break;
00640         case downstream_status_idle:
00641             TAILQ_REMOVE(&downstream->idle, connection, next);
00642             downstream->num_idle   -= 1;
00643             break;
00644         case downstream_status_down:
00645             TAILQ_REMOVE(&downstream->down, connection, next);
00646             downstream->num_down   -= 1;
00647             break;
00648         case downstream_status_nil:
00649             break;
00650         default:
00651             return -1;
00652     }
00653 
00654     TAILQ_INSERT_TAIL(&downstream->active, connection, next);
00655 
00656     downstream->num_active += 1;
00657     connection->status      = downstream_status_active;
00658 
00659     /* assuming set_active is used just prior to making any type of downstream
00660      * request, we set our start-time here. This is used to calculate an RTT
00661      * after the connection has been set back into the idle state
00662      */
00663     evutil_gettimeofday(&connection->tv_start, NULL);
00664 
00665     event_del(connection->retry_timer);
00666 
00667     return 0;
00668 } /* downstream_connection_set_active */
00669 
00677 downstream_c_t *
00678 downstream_connection_get_most_idle(rproxy_t * rproxy) {
00679     downstream_t * downstream;
00680     downstream_t * most_idle;
00681 
00682     most_idle = NULL;
00683 
00684     /* iterate over each downstream_t, check the num_idle variable on each one
00685      * until the largest number is found
00686      */
00687     TAILQ_FOREACH(downstream, &rproxy->downstreams, next) {
00688         if (most_idle == NULL) {
00689             most_idle = downstream;
00690             continue;
00691         }
00692 
00693         /* check to see if the number of idle connections in the current
00694          * downstream is higher than the saved downstream
00695          */
00696         if (downstream->num_idle > most_idle->num_idle) {
00697             /* this downstream has more idle connections, swap over most_idle to
00698              * use it
00699              */
00700             most_idle = downstream;
00701         }
00702     }
00703 
00704     if (most_idle) {
00705         assert(TAILQ_FIRST(&most_idle->idle) != NULL);
00706 
00707         /* return the first downstream connection in the downstream parent */
00708         return TAILQ_FIRST(&most_idle->idle);
00709     }
00710 
00711     /* no downstream connections are available */
00712     return NULL;
00713 }
00714 
00723 downstream_c_t *
00724 downstream_connection_get_lowest_rtt(rproxy_t * rproxy) {
00725     downstream_c_t * conn;
00726     downstream_c_t * save;
00727     downstream_t   * downstream;
00728 
00729     /* iterate through each downstream and their idle connection
00730      * children and return the connection with the lowest RTT
00731      */
00732 
00733     save = NULL;
00734 
00735     TAILQ_FOREACH(downstream, &rproxy->downstreams, next) {
00736         TAILQ_FOREACH(conn, &downstream->idle, next) {
00737             if (save == NULL) {
00738                 save = conn;
00739                 continue;
00740             }
00741 
00742             if (conn->rtt < save->rtt) {
00743                 save = conn;
00744             }
00745         }
00746     }
00747 
00748     return save;
00749 }
00750 
00758 downstream_c_t *
00759 downstream_connection_get_none(rproxy_t * rproxy) {
00760     downstream_t * downstream;
00761 
00762     /* iterate through each downstream and return the first available idle connection */
00763     TAILQ_FOREACH(downstream, &rproxy->downstreams, next) {
00764         if (downstream->num_idle == 0) {
00765             continue;
00766         }
00767 
00768         return TAILQ_FIRST(&downstream->idle);
00769     }
00770 
00771     return NULL;
00772 }
00773 
00783 downstream_c_t *
00784 downstream_connection_get_rr(rproxy_t * rproxy) {
00785     downstream_t   * last_used_downstream;
00786     downstream_t   * downstream;
00787     downstream_c_t * conn;
00788 
00789     assert(rproxy != NULL);
00790 
00791     if (TAILQ_FIRST(&rproxy->downstreams) == TAILQ_LAST(&rproxy->downstreams, downstream_q)) {
00792         /* only one downstream is configured, fall-back to RTT method */
00793         return downstream_connection_get_lowest_rtt(rproxy);
00794     }
00795 
00796     last_used_downstream = rproxy->last_downstream_used;
00797 
00798     if (!last_used_downstream) {
00799         downstream = TAILQ_FIRST(&rproxy->downstreams);
00800     } else {
00801         downstream = TAILQ_NEXT(last_used_downstream, next);
00802     }
00803 
00804     if (!downstream) {
00805         /* we're at the end of the list, circle back to the first */
00806         downstream = TAILQ_FIRST(&rproxy->downstreams);
00807     }
00808 
00809     conn = NULL;
00810 
00811     do {
00812         if (!downstream) {
00813             /* we have reached the end of the list, circle back to the first */
00814             downstream = TAILQ_FIRST(&rproxy->downstreams);
00815         }
00816 
00817         if ((downstream == last_used_downstream) && downstream->num_idle == 0) {
00818             /* we have wrapped back to the original, and we don't have any idle
00819              * connections here either, so we return NULL
00820              */
00821             return NULL;
00822         }
00823 
00824         if (downstream->num_idle == 0) {
00825             /* no idle connections for this downstream, try the next */
00826             downstream = TAILQ_NEXT(downstream, next);
00827             continue;
00828         }
00829 
00830         /* found a downstream with idle connections, so grab the first
00831          * connection and return
00832          */
00833 
00834         conn = TAILQ_FIRST(&downstream->idle);
00835         assert(conn != NULL);
00836 
00837         /* update the last used downstream pointer */
00838         rproxy->last_downstream_used = downstream;
00839         break;
00840     } while (1);
00841 
00842     return conn;
00843 } /* downstream_connection_get_rr */
00844 
00845 downstream_c_t *
00846 downstream_connection_get(rproxy_t * rproxy) {
00847     server_cfg_t * scfg;
00848 
00849     assert(rproxy != NULL);
00850     assert(rproxy->server_cfg != NULL);
00851 
00852     scfg = rproxy->server_cfg;
00853 
00854     switch (scfg->lbalance_method) {
00855         case lb_method_rtt:
00856             return downstream_connection_get_lowest_rtt(rproxy);
00857         case lb_method_most_idle:
00858             return downstream_connection_get_most_idle(rproxy);
00859         case lb_method_rr:
00860             return downstream_connection_get_rr(rproxy);
00861         case lb_method_none:
00862             return downstream_connection_get_none(rproxy);
00863         case lb_method_rand:
00864         default:
00865             logger_log_error(rproxy->logger, "[CRIT] Unknown loadbalance method %d", scfg->lbalance_method);
00866             break;
00867     }
00868 
00869     return NULL;
00870 }
00871 
00872 void
00873 downstream_connection_writecb(evbev_t * bev, void * arg) {
00874     downstream_c_t * connection;
00875     downstream_t   * downstream;
00876     rproxy_t       * rproxy;
00877     request_t      * request;
00878 
00879     connection = arg;
00880     downstream = connection->parent;
00881     rproxy     = downstream->rproxy;
00882     request    = connection->request;
00883 
00884     assert(connection != NULL);
00885 
00886 #ifdef RPROXY_DEBUG
00887 #ifdef  RPROXY_CRAZY_DEBUG
00888     printf("writecb: conn=%p, dstream=%p, rproxy=%p, request=%p\n",
00889            connection, downstream, rproxy, request);
00890 #endif
00891 #endif
00892 
00893     if (!request) {
00894         downstream_connection_set_down(connection);
00895         return;
00896     }
00897 
00898     if (request && request->upstream_request) {
00899         if (request->hit_highwm) {
00900             /* our high watermark was hit, but now all data has been written to
00901              * the downstream, thus we can resume processing
00902              */
00903 #if RPROXY_DEBUG
00904             printf("(RESUME UPSTREAM) upstream req status = %d\n",
00905                    request->upstream_request->status);
00906 #endif
00907 
00908             request->hit_highwm = 0;
00909             evhtp_request_resume(request->upstream_request);
00910         }
00911     }
00912 
00913     return;
00914 }
00915 
00924 void
00925 downstream_connection_eventcb(evbev_t * bev, short events, void * arg) {
00926     downstream_c_t * connection;
00927     downstream_t   * downstream;
00928     rproxy_t       * rproxy;
00929     int              res;
00930 
00931     assert(arg != NULL);
00932 
00933     connection = arg;
00934     downstream = connection->parent;
00935     assert(downstream != NULL);
00936 
00937     rproxy     = downstream->rproxy;
00938     assert(rproxy != NULL);
00939 
00940     if ((events & BEV_EVENT_CONNECTED)) {
00941         evutil_socket_t    sock;
00942         struct sockaddr_in sin;
00943         int                sinlen;
00944 
00945         sock   = bufferevent_getfd(bev);
00946         sinlen = sizeof(sin);
00947 
00948         getsockname(sock, (struct sockaddr *)&sin, &sinlen);
00949 
00950         connection->sport = ntohs(sin.sin_port);
00951 
00952         res = downstream_connection_set_idle(connection);
00953 
00954         assert(res >= 0);
00955         return;
00956     }
00957 
00958     if (connection->request) {
00959         request_t       * request    = connection->request;
00960         evhtp_request_t * up_request = request->upstream_request;
00961 
00962         request->error = 1;
00963 
00964         if (up_request) {
00965             evhtp_connection_t * up_conn = evhtp_request_get_connection(up_request);
00966 
00967             if (!request->upstream_err) {
00968                 evhtp_unset_all_hooks(&up_request->hooks);
00969 
00970                 logger_log_request_error(rproxy->logger, request,
00971                                          "[WARN] Downstream request proxy:%d -> %s:%d never completed",
00972                                          connection->sport,
00973                                          downstream->config->host,
00974                                          downstream->config->port);
00975 
00976                 request_free(request);
00977                 evhtp_connection_free(up_conn);
00978                 connection->request = NULL;
00979             }
00980 
00981             /* XXX: what happens if the upstream request doesn't have an error?
00982              * Well, the fini callback will be executed, and would result in a
00983              * double connection_set_down() call. This should be dealt with
00984              * differently to reduce overhead.
00985              */
00986         }
00987     }
00988 
00989     /* set the downstream connection to a downed state, which in turn
00990      * will attempt the reconnection process
00991      */
00992 
00993     if (connection && connection->status != downstream_status_down) {
00994         logger_log_error(rproxy->logger, "[CRIT] downstream socket event (source port=%d) error %d [ %s%s%s%s%s%s]",
00995                          connection->sport, events,
00996                          (events & BEV_EVENT_READING) ? "READING " : "",
00997                          (events & BEV_EVENT_WRITING) ? "WRITING " : "",
00998                          (events & BEV_EVENT_EOF)     ? "EOF " : "",
00999                          (events & BEV_EVENT_ERROR) ? "ERROR " : "",
01000                          (events & BEV_EVENT_TIMEOUT) ? "TIMEOUT " : "",
01001                          (events & BEV_EVENT_CONNECTED) ? "CONNECTED " : "");
01002     }
01003 
01004 
01005     res = downstream_connection_set_down(connection);
01006     assert(res >= 0);
01007 } /* downstream_connection_eventcb */
01008 
01016 void
01017 downstream_connection_readcb(evbev_t * bev, void * arg) {
01018     downstream_c_t * connection;
01019     downstream_t   * downstream;
01020     rproxy_t       * rproxy;
01021     request_t      * request;
01022     evbuf_t        * evbuf;
01023     void           * buf;
01024     size_t           avail;
01025     size_t           nread;
01026     struct timeval   diff;
01027     int              res;
01028 
01029     assert(arg != NULL);
01030 
01031     connection = arg;
01032     downstream = connection->parent;
01033     assert(downstream != NULL);
01034 
01035     rproxy     = downstream->rproxy;
01036     assert(rproxy != NULL);
01037 
01038     if (!(request = connection->request)) {
01039         /* XXX: technically we should never see this, deal with this as an error maybe? */
01040 
01041         /* we were signaled to read from the downstream, yet no request
01042          * has been associated with this connection, so we drain the input
01043          * buffers and return immediately.
01044          */
01045         evbuffer_drain(bufferevent_get_input(bev), -1);
01046         evbuffer_drain(bufferevent_get_output(bev), -1);
01047 
01048         downstream_connection_set_down(connection);
01049         return;
01050     }
01051 
01052     evbuf = bufferevent_get_input(bev);
01053     avail = evbuffer_get_length(evbuf);
01054     buf   = evbuffer_pullup(evbuf, avail);
01055 
01056     /* set our reading bit, this will inform any intermediary error type
01057      * callbacks to not free any resources while the parsing is being executed
01058      */
01059     request->reading = 1;
01060 
01061     nread = htparser_run(request->parser, &proxy_parser_hooks,
01062                          (const char *)buf, avail);
01063 
01064     /* unset our reading bit since we are no longer in our parsing loop */
01065     request->reading = 0;
01066 
01067     evbuffer_drain(evbuf, -1);
01068 
01069     if (nread != avail) {
01070         /* the request processing was aborted at some point, so
01071          * we mark it as an error
01072          */
01073         request->error = 1;
01074     }
01075 
01076     assert(request->upstream_request != NULL);
01077 
01078     if (request->done && !REQUEST_HAS_ERROR(request)) {
01079         /* downstream response has been fully processed and marked
01080          * as completed with no error conditions. End the streaming
01081          * reply to the upstream and log the request
01082          *
01083          * This will eventually call the upstream_fini() function after all data
01084          * has been written to the upstream.
01085          */
01086 
01087         logger_log_request(rproxy->logger, request);
01088 
01089         return evhtp_send_reply_end(request->upstream_request);
01090     }
01091 
01092     if (REQUEST_HAS_ERROR(request)) {
01093         /* deal with whatever type of error happened */
01094 
01095         if (request->upstream_err) {
01096             /* upstream_error() was triggered, which means the upstream encountered
01097              * a socket error. If the request is marked as done, we can keep the
01098              * downstream connection open, otherwise we must shut it down.
01099              *
01100              * since upstream_error() unsets all the hooks associated with this
01101              * request, it should never call upstream_fini, so we can safely free
01102              * our resources and set our downstream connection status however we want.
01103              */
01104             if (request->done) {
01105                 downstream_connection_set_idle(connection);
01106             } else {
01107                 downstream_connection_set_down(connection);
01108             }
01109         } else if (request->error) {
01110             /* our downstream parsing encountered an error, if the request has been
01111              * marked as done, we can send the final response, otherwise we send a
01112              * 503 type error.
01113              */
01114             evhtp_unset_all_hooks(&request->upstream_request->hooks);
01115 
01116             if (request->done) {
01117                 logger_log_request(rproxy->logger, request);
01118                 evhtp_send_reply_end(request->upstream_request);
01119             } else {
01120                 downstream_connection_set_down(connection);
01121             }
01122         }
01123 
01124         /* free up our request */
01125         request_free(request);
01126     }
01127 
01128     /* if we get to here, we are not done with downstream -> upstream IO */
01129 } /* downstream_connection_readcb */
01130 
01139 void
01140 downstream_connection_retry(int sock, short which, void * arg) {
01141     downstream_c_t   * connection;
01142     downstream_t     * downstream;
01143     rproxy_t         * rproxy;
01144     struct sockaddr_in sin;
01145 
01146     assert(arg != NULL);
01147 
01148     connection = arg;
01149     downstream = connection->parent;
01150     assert(downstream != NULL);
01151 
01152     rproxy     = downstream->rproxy;
01153     assert(rproxy != NULL);
01154 
01155     if (connection->connection) {
01156         bufferevent_free(connection->connection);
01157     }
01158 
01159 
01160     sin.sin_family         = AF_INET;
01161     sin.sin_addr.s_addr    = inet_addr(downstream->config->host);
01162     sin.sin_port           = htons(downstream->config->port);
01163 
01164     connection->connection = bufferevent_socket_new(downstream->evbase, -1,
01165                                                     BEV_OPT_CLOSE_ON_FREE);
01166 
01167     assert(connection->connection != NULL);
01168 
01169 
01170     bufferevent_setcb(connection->connection,
01171                       downstream_connection_readcb,
01172                       downstream_connection_writecb,
01173                       downstream_connection_eventcb, connection);
01174 
01175     /* once the socket has connected (or errored), the
01176      * downstream_connection_eventcb function is called.
01177      */
01178     bufferevent_socket_connect(connection->connection,
01179                                (struct sockaddr *)&sin, sizeof(sin));
01180 
01181     {
01182         /* if configured, apply our read/write timeouts on the downstream
01183          * connection.
01184          */
01185         int            s_read  = 0;
01186         int            s_write = 0;
01187         struct timeval r_tv    = { 0 };
01188         struct timeval w_tv    = { 0 };
01189 
01190         if (downstream->config->read_timeout) {
01191             r_tv.tv_sec = downstream->config->read_timeout;
01192             s_read      = 1;
01193         }
01194 
01195         if (downstream->config->write_timeout) {
01196             w_tv.tv_sec = downstream->config->write_timeout;
01197             s_write     = 1;
01198         }
01199 
01200         if (s_read || s_write) {
01201             bufferevent_set_timeouts(connection->connection,
01202                                      s_read ? &r_tv : NULL,
01203                                      s_write ? &w_tv : NULL);
01204         }
01205     }
01206 
01207     bufferevent_enable(connection->connection, EV_READ | EV_WRITE);
01208 } /* downstream_connection_retry */
01209 
01224 int
01225 downstream_connection_init(evbase_t * evbase, downstream_t * downstream) {
01226     int i;
01227 
01228     if (evbase == NULL || downstream == NULL) {
01229         return -1;
01230     }
01231 
01232     downstream->evbase = evbase;
01233 
01234     for (i = 0; i < downstream->config->connections; i++) {
01235         downstream_c_t * connection;
01236         int              res;
01237 
01238         if (!(connection = downstream_connection_new(evbase, downstream))) {
01239             logger_log_error(downstream->rproxy->logger,
01240                              "[CRIT] Could not create new downstream connection! %s",
01241                              strerror(errno));
01242             exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
01243         }
01244 
01245         res = downstream_connection_set_down(connection);
01246         assert(res >= 0);
01247     }
01248 
01249     return 0;
01250 }
01251 
01257 void
01258 downstream_connection_free(downstream_c_t * connection) {
01259     if (connection == NULL) {
01260         return;
01261     }
01262 
01263     if (connection->retry_timer) {
01264         event_free(connection->retry_timer);
01265     }
01266 
01267     if (connection->connection) {
01268         bufferevent_free(connection->connection);
01269     }
01270 
01271     free(connection);
01272 }
01273 
01284 downstream_c_t *
01285 downstream_connection_new(evbase_t * evbase, downstream_t * downstream) {
01286     downstream_c_t * connection;
01287 
01288     if (evbase == NULL) {
01289         return NULL;
01290     }
01291 
01292     if (!(connection = calloc(sizeof(downstream_c_t), 1))) {
01293         return NULL;
01294     }
01295 
01296     connection->parent       = downstream;
01297     connection->rtt          = DBL_MAX;
01298     connection->status       = downstream_status_nil;
01299     connection->bootstrapped = 0;
01300 
01301     connection->retry_timer  = evtimer_new(evbase, downstream_connection_retry, connection);
01302 
01303     return connection;
01304 }
01305 
01311 void
01312 downstream_free(downstream_t * downstream) {
01313     downstream_c_t * conn;
01314     downstream_c_t * save;
01315 
01316     if (downstream == NULL) {
01317         return;
01318     }
01319 
01320     /* free all of the active/idle/down connections */
01321     for (conn = TAILQ_FIRST(&downstream->active); conn; conn = save) {
01322         save = TAILQ_NEXT(conn, next);
01323 
01324         downstream_connection_free(conn);
01325     }
01326 
01327     for (conn = TAILQ_FIRST(&downstream->idle); conn; conn = save) {
01328         save = TAILQ_NEXT(conn, next);
01329 
01330         downstream_connection_free(conn);
01331     }
01332 
01333     for (conn = TAILQ_FIRST(&downstream->down); conn; conn = save) {
01334         save = TAILQ_NEXT(conn, next);
01335 
01336         downstream_connection_free(conn);
01337     }
01338 
01339     free(downstream);
01340 }
01341 
01351 downstream_t *
01352 downstream_new(rproxy_t * rproxy, downstream_cfg_t * cfg) {
01353     downstream_t * downstream;
01354 
01355     if (!(downstream = calloc(sizeof(downstream_t), 1))) {
01356         return NULL;
01357     }
01358 
01359     downstream->config = cfg;
01360     downstream->rproxy = rproxy;
01361 
01362     TAILQ_INIT(&downstream->active);
01363     TAILQ_INIT(&downstream->idle);
01364     TAILQ_INIT(&downstream->down);
01365 
01366     return downstream;
01367 }
